text.0: father of maruts let thy bliss approach us exclude us not from looking on the sunlight.
text.1: gracious to our fleet courser be the hero may we transplant us rudra in our children.
text.2: with the most saving medicines which thou givest rudra may i attain a hundred winters.
text.3: far from us banish enmity and hatred and to all quarters maladies and trouble.
text.4: chief of all born art thou in glory rudra armed with the thunder mightiest of the mighty.
text.5: transport us over trouble to wellbeing repel thou from us all assaults of mischief.
text.6: let us not anger thee with worship rudra ill praise strong god or mingled invocation.
text.7: do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes i hear thee famed as best of all physicians.
text.8: may i with praisesongs win that rudras favour who is adored with gifts and invocations.
text.9: neer may the tawny god fairchecked and gracious swifthearing yield us to this evil purpose.
text.10: the strong begirt by maruts hath refreshed me with most invigorating food imploring.
text.11: as he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may i uninjured win the bliss of rudra.
text.12: where is that gracious hand of thine o rudra the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort.
text.13: remover of the woe that gods have sent us o strong one look thou on me with compassion.
text.14: to him the strong great tawny faircomplexioned i utter forth a mighty hymn of praises.
text.15: we serve the brilliant god with adorations we glorify the splendid name of rudra.
text.16: with firm limbs multiform the strong the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations.
text.17: the strength of godhead neer departs from rudra him who is sovran of this world the mighty.
text.18: worthy thou carriest thy bow and arrows worthy thy manyhued and honoured necklace.
text.19: worthy thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces a mightier than thou there is not rudra.
text.20: praise him the chariotborne the young the famous fierce slaying like a dread beast of the forest.
text.21: o rudra praised be gracious to the singer let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.
text.22: i bend to thee as thou approachest rudra even as a boy before the sire who greets him.
text.23: i praise thee bounteous giver lord of heroes give medicines to us as thou art lauded.
text.24: of your pure medicines o potent maruts those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing.
text.25: those which our father manu hath selected i crave from rudra for our gain and welfare.
text.26: may rudras missile turn aside and spare us the great wrath of the impetuous one avoid us.
text.27: turn bounteous god thy strong bow from our princes and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.
text.28: o tawny bull thus showing forth thy nature as neither to be wroth o god nor slay us.
text.29: here rudra listen to our invocation loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
